perturbation.original_text:
Stage 6:
The service fee of NTD 3 million (SAY THREE MILLION ONLY) shall be paid after the Development Plan is adopted.
perturbation.changed_text:
Stage 6:
The service fee of NTD 3 million (SAY THREE MILLION ONLY) shall be paid within 30 days of the Development Plan being adopted.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment upon adoption. The changed text adds a 30-day deadline, potentially conflicting with other implied payment terms. If, for example, Stage 7 is contingent on Stage 6, this could create a situation where Party A is obligated to move forward with Stage 7 before the 30-day payment window for Stage 6 closes.

perturbation.original_text: In case the Contract cannot be performed due to any reason other than the architect herein, the client agrees the fees paid will not be refunded. In case the Contract cannot be performed due to the architect herein, the architect shall refund the fees paid in full without taking any interest to the client.
perturbation.changed_text: In case the Contract cannot be performed due to any reason other than the architect herein, the client agrees the fees paid will not be refunded unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties in writing. In case the Contract cannot be performed due to the architect herein, the architect shall refund 50% of the fees paid without taking any interest to the client, provided the architect has provided a reasonable amount of service.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states no refunds if non-architect reasons cause termination and full refunds if architect reasons cause termination. The changed text allows for negotiated refunds in the former and reduces the refund to 50% with a service quality stipulation in the latter, creating a contradiction in the original, absolute terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Article XI.
Disputes Resolving

Both parties herein agree to resolve any dispute regarding interpretation of the Contract in the following methods:
I. Should both Parties be unable to reach an agreement within one month through negotiation, they may apply for an arbitration in Miaoli County and the arbitration result shall be compulsory.
II. Should either Party herein initiate a legal proceeding for revoking any arbitration result regarding the Contract, both Parties herein agree to take the Miaoli District Court of Taiwan as the competent court of first instance pursuant to the laws of the R.O.C..
perturbation.changed_text:
Article XI.
Disputes Resolving

Both parties herein agree to resolve any dispute regarding interpretation of the Contract in the following methods:
I. Should both Parties be unable to reach an agreement within one month through negotiation, they are required to attend mediation facilitated by a mutually agreed-upon mediator before considering arbitration. Arbitration is only available after unsuccessful mediation in Miaoli County and the arbitration result shall be compulsory.
II. Should either Party herein initiate a legal proceeding regardless of the mediation or arbitration results regarding the Contract, both Parties herein agree to take the Taipei District Court of Taiwan as the competent court of first instance pursuant to the laws of the R.O.C..
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces a mandatory mediation step before arbitration, contradicting the original option to directly proceed to arbitration after one month of unsuccessful negotiation. Furthermore, the text changes the competent court from Miaoli District Court to Taipei District Court, making the location of the dispute resolution process ambiguous.
